Reviews.Title: “Do you want the maid in your room while sleeping?”
Reviews.Author: soho12
Reviews.Content: It happened twice, I told the front desk that it was not ok for the maid to enter the room when I was sleeping, then it happened again the day after. The hotel is nice some rooms have a bad smell and some are ok, I book 2 rooms for me and my mom. The service was ok but I would never stay in a hotel again where you dont if you get a surprice in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel, great location, a bargain price!”
Reviews.Author: Wordypirate
Reviews.Content: Me and my sis stayed here (booked through Citalia) and found the hotel a great bargain. We got the train, late at night from the airport and came out at the wrong end on the station and admittedly we were a bit concerned as it looked a little rough-but if we had come out the main entrance and headed straight for the hotel-the area is absolutely fine. It's in walking distance of the Forum, Colloseum, all the major attractions. There's lot of great restaurants, cafe's nearby. The staff are friendly, the breakfast has enough of a range to keep you going for the day. If you're looking for luxury, this isn't that kind of hotel-but it's a good hotel, the rooms are good sizes with spotlessly clean facilities. We loved it. Rome is fantastic and just get some comfy shoes on and walk it-if you can. On foot, you can see just about everything but if not there's plenty of buses and the underground. We walked everywhere. I would highly recommend, Pallatine Hill, the Forum, Colloseum and see Circus Maximus-where everyone walks there dogs! Buy a ticket from the Forum-and get into the Collosseum and Pallatine Hill as well-much cheaper than paying seperately and also if the Collosseum is busy you get through the line quicker. My least favourite was the Vatican-I know its a hot spot but I found the place busy and would have rather spent the day elsewhere. Obviously if you are religious it's a must see. The Pantheon is so intersting as is the area around, filled with shops and busy cafe's. If you have time, catch the train down to modern Pompei town and visit the ancient city-a spectacular must see! Oh and if you come in November where warm clothing!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and a beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: maxine c
Reviews.Content: We have jsut returned from a fantastic stay in Rome; a birthday present from my husband. We spent 3 days in Rome, staying at the Hotel San Remo. I did read the reviews however i remained open minded as people do have differing expectations of 3* hotels. I am pleased I did! The hotel was in an absolutely fantastic location for sightseeing everything in Rome. We walked everywhere and unless you have an aversion to walking, everthing is within walking distance; no need for the bus or metro. We went with our 4 year old daughter and she had no probelms either. On entering the hotel we were greeted by friendly staff and were checked in quickly. A junior member of staff helped us take our luggage to our room using the lift. Our room was basic but on a par with the many 3 star hotels we have stayed in elsewhere in the world. It was large, had plenty of storage space and the beds were comfortable and clean. The room had individually controlled heating and a TV and fridge, which was handy. The bathroom was beautifully clean and well stocked with plenty of fresh towels. Yes the water pressure wasn't fantastic and a little luke-warm in the mornings but it was fine for washing my, rather long, hair! Breakfast was a feast of everything continental and the staff nothing but kind and helpful- they wanted you to have a good breakfast! The location was considerably quiet, for the world's noisiest city! This was a perfect short stay and I could not fault the staff, the room or the hospitaility we received in the hotel San Remo, it was fantastic! I would definitely recommend this to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a short break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dounelinz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the start of our honeymoon. I didnt expect anything spectacular from the hotel and therefore was not disappointed. Its nothing flash but it was clean, well located, had air con and a comfy bed. All that you need if you plan to be out sightseeing all day anyway. There was plenty to eat at breakfast but the tea and coffee could have been a bit nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but..........”
Reviews.Author: bfeeny
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel was in an excellent location for our explorations of Rome, the hotel is in dire need of a renovation and especially a coat of paint. The room furnishings were fairly new but very Spartan. The bathtub and facets need replacing. There were scuff marks on the wall in our room that were not cleaned the whole time we were there and we ran out of hot water in the morning. Breakfast was good and the front desk very helpful but we would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn`t recommend”
Reviews.Author: scorryuk
Reviews.Content: First impressions were that it wasnt too bad but by day 3 I couldn`t wait to leave and from what I saw of other 3 star hotels in the area the San Remo definately seemed to lag behind. Sore points included the cockroaches scampering for cover in our room, the strange smell in our room, the lack of any hot water, the air con didnt work, the lift felt like a death trap ready to plunge to the bottom at any moment. Also the hotel "lounge" feels more like a hospital waiting room- you wont want to spend any time there. We went to the Great Western around the corner and used their sofas and bar! Saw another couples room and it definately seemed better than ours but no hot water for them. I suppose if all you want is a bed for the night close to the Termini then this will fit the bill. But with so many other much nicer hotels close by I cant see why anyone would chose here. Thought the accomodation tax that had to be paid in cash before check out was a bit of an insult but guess thats Rome for you.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Retired0207
Reviews.Content: 2nd Visit still a good experience, convenient for all transport and within walking distance of some sites. Very clean, friendly staff. Breakfast good and better than last stay. Only downside bathrooms clean but dated and need upgrading, water not hot enough unless you pick your time. Would certainly re\commend as value for money and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: Gibo47
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently situated for Termini and getting into centre of Rome. Buy a Roma pass and you can use every bus, minibus, train, tube free!!! Despite negative reviews I've read its fine. The beds are hard but comfy, bathrooms very old but clean and serviced with clean towels everyday. Water is a bit of a trickle and they do need to get it sorted so the more who write and complain the better. Breakfast is more than adequate. Nice fresh rolls, meats, cheese, cereals, croissants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Basic 3* hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelGalEngland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in October 2011 with a friend. Even tho all we wanted was a clean hotel to put our heads down there are a few things that would of made our stay more comfortable. Check in was quick and easy, we were on the 5th floor so took the 1 lift the hotel had, it was a small lift which didnt feel too safe and was veruy slow at times we thought it had stopped. From then on we tended to take the stairs. The rooms were basic but had all we needed for a city hotel. There was a TV which only one English station (who cares as you dont spend anytime in the room). There was a shower over the bath but the shower curtain went around in a circle so you had no space and the curtain stuck to you which was really annoying! The water was never hot just luke warm. The walls here very think and if someone went to the toilet or had a shower in the room next to yours then you could hear everything at one stage I thought they were going to come thru in our room!!! The beds are the worse I have ever slept in, there were so narrow and so hard let when the laid down the mattress didnt give at all!!! You needed a good nights sleep after walking around seeing the wonerful sights that Rome offers. There were towels in the room and the rooms were cleaned everyday. The hotel is in a good location, so close to the Termini (metro/train main station) and was not far from the colosseum. There is a restraurant on the street corner just a stones throw from the hotel which we eat in a few times, it was clean cheap and friendly. The staff at the hotel spoke ok English was sometimes hard to explain things but I think maybe they played on it at time speically when someone complained. The hotel offered breakfast which had a small selection of ceral, cake etc. The hotel did have a small bar but we never used that and didnt ever see anyone in it. I wouldnt stay here again. My advise for the hotel is swap beds and shower curtains and sort the hot water out and then you would be a great hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “There has to be better”
Reviews.Author: Nigel M
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of reviews we decided despite some poor reviews to stay at the San Remo for three nights. A big mistake. The hotel was in a good location & it was clean, reasonably friendly (Providing you had no complaints) & should have suited our needs. Biggest problem was the hot water. Unless you want to shower in the early hours of the morning or mid afternoon you have no chance of a shower with warm water. When I raised this with the receptionist she actually laughed yes laughed & pointed to a sign that stated, they where having a problem with the boiler. Ok but this sign was not a computer print out it was a plastic semi permanent professionally manufactured sign which would suggest this was an ongoing & regular problem that would never be fixed. Indeed we never had warm water the whole time unless at six in the morning. Other problems where internet was not working, I could live with that, The bed was as hard as a park bench well almost, they seem not to have enough bed clothes as we ended up with no bed spread, lights that didn’t work, lack of ice for our drinks etc etc. We where not looking for a fancy hotel & we have stayed in many three star hotels & all we required was a base. I have only stayed in one that was worse. The hotel is very tired half the things don’t work & worst of all the staff just don’t give a dam, no point in complaining because they just don’t care. I would never stay in the San Remo again there has to be better three star hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable but lacks hot water”
Reviews.Author: Trembl38
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Transat Hollidays. The price for the package was good so we can't complain, we got what we paid for. This to say, the hotel is located at couple of hundred meters from Termini station (train, metro main station) so very easy to get around from here. People at the hotel were friendly, but the first day we got there we had hard time with hot water, and they did nothing to get this fixed for the whole week, so we had to take a cold shower pretty much every day, save one or two medium cold ones... Other then that, the hotel is nice, with statues and Roman stylish decoration all around. The room we got had a balcony (not all do) so we could look out and see Roman live going on. Speaking of which, it starts early in the morning. They pickup garbage every day and they do it twice a day, one of which is 4 am. There seem to be noise (people are loud) all over the night so if you go in the summer, opening a window might not be a good ide. I am not complaining about the noise myself, I loved it, seemed to me that Felini's Roma, had to be like this. I also liked the way the hotel was located. The hotel offers a buffet every morning but it's a light one, so don't expect a big american style breakfast. There was only one computer and no Internet in the room, so sending an email did not materialized for me, since there was allways someone at the computer. The employees speak English so we managed to get stuff we needed (save the hot water) the room was cleaned and wide by european standards. Other then that, just being in Rome was enough to make any place a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fine”
Reviews.Author: OddsoxWalsall
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of average/ poor reviews before spending a long weekend in Rome. 3 nights at San Remo - I can only asume that the reviews are from people, who wanted to live in the hotel (rather than just sleep) - if you treat it like a Premier Inn, excellent. All staff very friendly & helpful - when I wanted to watch the rugby-keen to help & check afterwards that I had found venue. Location could not be better, superb base. Loads of restaurants in all surrounding streets meant you could return to hotel, shower change & out again to eat in no time. Room was modest - as expected, but clean & towels changed every day, bathroom fittings old fashioned - but plenty of hot water. I do stay in hotels at London prices & San Remo was worth value for money. Refine your expectations

Reviews.Title: “Bear in mind Rome is expensive”
Reviews.Author: hillmart
Reviews.Content: So I guess most of the other reviews are correct and we have become rather spoiled so, yes, San Remo is dated and in poor shape. I did find the staff helpful and the location is good. Room was clean but it needed a new bathroom, AC didn't work but it wasn't too warm in the room. Breakfasts weren't great and if you can book without it I would go round the corner to one of the many bistros. Hotels in Rome are so expensive so if you're on a budget the San Remo is ok, if you want something special then save up a bit longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Brian G
Reviews.Content: clean tidy hotel room ,was fantasic ,cleaned every day staff were very freindly and helpfull would recommend, staying here close to main attractions and terminni station

Reviews.Title: “Best part was "Check Out"”
Reviews.Author: Taylor1979
Reviews.Content: Positives: location is 5 mins from the Termini Station which is the main hub for travel on bus, train, metro etc. Negatives: hotel staff have zero skills in dealing with public. Rooms are old and unkept and smell bad. If there is hot water it usually is only warm and when taking a shower you don't even need to mix cold as the hot water isn't even hot. Bathtubs often leak and soak floor in bathroom. Bathtubs are chipped and old. Calling this hotel a 3 star is pushing it. I would rate it a 2 star as cleanliness is lacking, rooms are old and in disrepair, staff are unfriendly, the hot water system is inadequate, beds are hard and uneven and in general the hotel is uncomfortable and unfriendly! If not for the central location this hotel would have failed on all accounts.

Reviews.Title: “OK for Price”
Reviews.Author: Trish255
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with friends and found the location great and the hotel was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. Overall great hotel and location for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Littlecurly
Reviews.Content: We recently booked in to this hotel for 2 nights on my first trip to Rome. Apart from the location we were very disappointed with our stay. Our main issue was the leaky bathroom that smelt (very strongly) of urine for the entire stay. We mentioned the large amount of water on the floor to reception staff who advised this would be fixed and when we returned that evening the water was gone but the smell remained. The bathroom also looked tired, as did all the public areas of the hotel. And the lift was soooo slow and small that it was quicker to walk the 3 flights of stairs on every occassion. On a positive note, the staff were friendly & accommodated our requests with booking a taxi etc. & the location is very close to the train station. This hotel is overpriced and is in need of a good renovation/upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel San Remo: well located”
Reviews.Author: Sylvain L
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Remo location, close to the Termini train Station, is useful for traveler. From the airport, take the Leonardo da Vinci express and you are there faster than by any other means (½ hour). Also, travelers can easily take trains to all around Roma. The area is not the most beautiful in town but you can walk to the main mosts in Rome (though it is far from the Vatican). Also, it is close to the Barberini Taverna = one of our favorite restaurant in Roma). The hotel personnel is polite. Our room was clean. We were jet-lagged and late at our first breakfast and the waitress has been very nice with us and let us eat with a smile. Breakfasts, which are included in the room cost, are OK and the same every morning.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Ahall1976
Reviews.Content: The hotel was sold to us by citalia as a 3 star but was more like a one star. The brochure does not show what it is really like! The decor is poor with electric sockets having gaps a round which are very dangerous as they we in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “OVER BOOKED”
Reviews.Author: Marcus S
Reviews.Content: Booked in with wedding party for a room booked in January 2011, yet claimed they were overbooked. I believe this hotel is just a front, they so called 'overbook' get £ X's from you for your booking then book you in a sh ite hole around the corner which cost them £X divided by 3. I would not book with this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “OVER BOOKED”
Reviews.Author: bardhub
Reviews.Content: I would like to write a review of this hotel but despite the fact we researched which hotel we wanted based on tripadvisor reviews and booked in May, we got no further than reception, where we were told they were overbooked and had booked us into a nearby alternative hotel. The hotel we were sent to did not unfortunately live up to our aspirations for our accommodation but we were determined not to let this spoil our Rome experience, it was clean with plenty of hot water and we got some breakfast each morning. The Express train from the airport seems a little steep at 14 euro each for a 30 minute journey but it is easy to locate and is non stop direct to the Termini station. The sights are awesome and the location of accommodation near the Termini is ideal for walking to virtually all of them , Keep a small bottle of water with you at all times,available from supermarkets at about 30p (2 euro off the hawkers outside the coliseum) as there there are regular public taps where you can top up. The underground is brilliant 75 mins travel for 1euro, buy the tickets from the ticket machines , just hit the union jack and simple to follow steps in english, beware the guys looking out for tourists to assist for a tip. Buy tickets for the vatican museums and coliseum over the internet in advance , we were just ushered passed the crowds queuing to purchase tickets on site in temperatures of 40 degrees. Drinks are very expensive 6 euro for a pint of larger wine is more reasonable, For an inexpensive treat Coffee in Macdonalds 1euro ,milk shakes also 1euro We spent an afternoon visiting the main park up the Spanish steps and turn left (very close to Spagna underground station) was originally the gardens of Villa Borghes lots to see with gardens, fountains, museums, cycle hire, fairground rides,lakes and of course cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: samm28
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the San Remo hotel at the end of May. It was a great place to stay while in Rome. It is located about 10mins walking distance from the Termini train station and subway station (termini). The hotel is near a lot of cafes and restaurants, also since its near the train station you can take advantage of the shops and restaurants that are in the station. Another bonus is that you are about 15mins walking distance from the church Santa Maria Maggiore and just 20mins away from the colosseo. The hotel itself was very nice, the front desk was very helpful in answering our questions. The room was very modern and up to date. The continental breakfast that was included with our room, was very good for a 4 star hotel. You had a great selection of food and the staff was very friendly. I recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: oldbaldmanbob Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the San Remo August 2011 for 5 nights. Bedroom and bathroom very clean and adequate. Breakfast ok with good choice. Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel, will be back”
Reviews.Author: Rose-Anne R
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were lovely,helpful and kind. The room was comfortable, clean and spacious - very big, Our 7 year old and 3 year old had a great time. We did not spend too much time at the hotel as there was so much we needed to see and enjoy in Rome, but when we return we will stay here again. Excellent location, near Termini station. Thank you for making our stay in Roma memorable!

Reviews.Title: “good location but basic”
Reviews.Author: ronandlauren
Reviews.Content: situated in a rather dusty side road but very close to termini rail station but a bit dingy and shabby inside.handy and central for most of the main tourist attractions

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location near Termini station & huge room”
Reviews.Author: felicia1502
Reviews.Content: I booked a triple room inclusive of breakfast through Octopus travel. It was our 1st Rome trip together as a family. As it was our last stop in Italy, our luggages were expected to be heavier, therefore decided to get a hotel near the train station to minimise the strain. It was a breeze locating the hotel as we googled the location before our trip and it was only a mere 3 mins walk to the hotel. Check in was smooth and to our surprise, the rooms we booked was much more spacious than the other hotels we stayed in Italy. There were 2 queen bed and ample space to place our opened luggages. Breakfast buffet was rather disappointing. Coffee was sour and tasted awful. We just had roll with ham for 2 days. On our last day as we checked out at 6.45am, breakfast was not ready. Therefore the receptionist gave us 3 bags of breakfast takeaway. It was so thoughtful of him.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the train station”
Reviews.Author: Dee198407
Reviews.Content: This was an average hotel in terms of the room, nothing fancy. The breakfast was good and it is close to the termini station which makes it convenient. The staff spoke resonably good English and most of them were friendly and helpful. It wasn't great but it wasn't bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Modest but Clean and Central”
Reviews.Author: horseraceon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 3 star, typical European, modest by North American standards but very clean and the staff are attentive. What they call a cold buffet breakfast in the brochure is head and shoulders above what North Americans would recieve at at Comfort Inn etc Lots of fruit, cereals, variety of cold cheeses and meats, eggs, bread, rolls etc. Easy to make up a take away lunch for you day tour if you want. Central to everything and can walk to many of the more popular site. Lots of reasonable restaurants within a 3 block walk

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff an the most uncomfortable bed..!!”
Reviews.Author: Georginaandemma
Reviews.Content: We booked a week to Rome with Citalia. Upon arrival the receptionist on duty was quite friendly but the other reception staff were actually quit rude, We got in our room and jumped on our bed to find it was rock hard. We had no hot water for the week and the hair dryer didn't work. I asked the receptionist for a hairdryer and she basically threw it at me. The Hotel is situated down a seedy little back street but conveniently near the main train station Termini which was helpful for jumping on the Metro. So all in all we had hardly much sleep due the hard bed's and cold shower's every morning/evening. I would'nt recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: gillngary
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at he San remo hotel staff friendly and helpful the location of the hotel us brilliant only a 15 min walk to the forum and coliseum used the hop on bus which took us the Vatican area and we walked back its not too far plus you get to explore beautiful streets. Breakfast was good plenty of choice. Lots of little restuarants located near to hotel If you feel you cannot walk too far at night !! Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value -very central location”
Reviews.Author: marie_madders
Reviews.Content: .. Stayed here with my adult daughter for 6 nights leaving 6th June. Having visted Rome on 3 previous occasions I am aware that it is an expensive place to stay. Wanted a clean comfortable base knowing we would be out sightseeing every day This ticked all the boxes. Room not particularly big but comfortable and well cleaned every day. All staff we dealt with welcoming and friendly. Note previous review mentions poor breakfast but this was far from our experience - very efficient service and food simple but fresh and nice. When we arrived at hotel noted outer frame of bedroom door was broken but this did not affect our security. It was a pity as it initially gave a slightly negative impression. Our room had a balcony overlooking the street - a nice touch and we had no noise issues at all. Well located for Termini station though we enjoyed walked almost everywhere. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Judging a hotel like this it is important to remember how expensive in Rome accommodation can be and as it was just a short sightseeing trip we chose not to splash out on the 4 star we usually choose for holidays. An excellent find and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't opt to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel2230
Reviews.Content: Friends booked this hotel for part of our group holiday so it was a package deal for the first part of our trip. I personally wouldn't stay here again - the room is very basic with tiny single beds but the worst part was the bathroom which was very dated, rusty and dirty and although I ran a bath no sooner did I get in than I got out again as the smell was dreadful. It's more difficult to complain when you are in a group situation and it can quite often be the case that one persons dream is another's nightmare. I would have preferred a nicer hotel on my first trip to Rome as it's a very romantic city but there is nothing romantic about the hotel or indeed nothing comfortable. We stayed out for as long as we could, only going back to shower, change and sleep and couldn't wait to leave which is a real shame as the lobby is inviting as is the impressive stairwell. Unfortunately the bedrooms and the dining room let it all down with a poor breakfast service, so much so that we preferred to go around the corner for a coffee and a pastry instead of eating in the hotel. Such a shame as the location is great and the staff that we dealt with were very pleasant so maybe it's just a matter of opinion about the rooms/bathrooms but being well travelled, I personally wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful! Disgusting rooms and rude staff. AVOID!!!”
Reviews.Author: clkaylor
Reviews.Content: After booking through "The luxury Italian holiday specialists" Citalia we had good expectations of this place. My advice, ignore the pictures of the lovely reception room and the three star rating. The place was an absolute hovel and the staff were disgraceful. An absolute rip off! Location: Hotel is in a central location near Termini station but a little hard to find as it's on a small side street. Reception: When we arrived, we couldn't find it so called to ask for directions. The man who answered wouldn't speak to my boyfriend, just said the street name and slammed the phone down. I called and he was really nice, clearly he is only interested in speaking to females! Upon arrival the lady on reception tried to keep our passports, very dodgy! We left them with her to photocopy them and went to get them back later that evening but we had a job getting her to part with them! When walking in and out of the hotel, reception staff do not even acknowlege you. The maids were more polite and seemed to be doing their best, it's not their fault the place is so disgusting! Room: We were given a key and pointed up the stairs. Got to the room to find the door was held on with duct tape, not a joke, literally, held on with duct tape! There was a big gap at the bottom and we couldn't lock so we had no privacy whatsoever. We overlooked this in the hope the inside would be nice, like in the photos... No chance! Skirting boards had come off and were left propped up against the wall, Wooden floor was bumpy where there must have previously been a flood in the bathroom, we were given single beds despite booking a double room, no proper duvets, just sheets and tatty old brown fleece blankets. Bathroom: The lock on the bathroom door had been removed and the hole where it once was had been filled with toilet roll. There was a shower but the attachment to hold it on the wall had been broken off making it impossible to wash your hair without help (thankfully I was with my partner) Grouting had turned brown, everything was old and a bit manky to be frank! How the staff dealt with the issues: We went to reception and asked for another room and were told no rooms were available. We asked for someone to fix what they could while we were out, we were told the caretaker had gone home for the day. We asked for the bed to be made up as a double and were told the maids had also left... I then asked for some sheets so i could change them myself and was told they didn't have access to the laundry!! The staff didn't seem to think all of this was an issue! We pointed out that we shouldn't even be in that room as we'd booked a double, to which a man replied "Well normally Japanese couples request separate beds, even when they're on honeymoon!" A totally random and irrelevant comment seeing as how neither me or my partner are Japanese! No apology was given, only after ALOT of arguing did they say they'd try and get us another room the next day. All in all we paid £74 a night for this poor experience, our 4 nights there was a huge waste of money! The room we were eventually given was clean enough and at least wan't falling apart I suppose. It was on the top floor so I think one of their "Superior" rooms but still didn't warrant a 3 star rating. The lights in the head board flickered all night making it hard to sleep and the doors weren't at all sound proof. Rome itself is a nice place, but it seems to be common practise in restaurants to treat customers based on presumed wealth. Expect to be treated as a second class citizen if you are under the age of 25 and don't have children. As a young couple, we were pretty much ignored by waiters, at the restaurant on the corner opposite the Termini we waited an hour for two soups whereas older couples and families were served within minutes.

Reviews.Title: “The San Remo-lovely”
Reviews.Author: Chrisrob903
Reviews.Content: What a lovely stay we had for 5 days. The front staff were always very friendly and helpful. The dinning room staff could not do enough for us and always greeted us with a smile. It was situated perfectly for the trains and metro service. The only thing I can really moan at is that I swapped rooms with my kids and I ended up with a pretty hard bed, they on the other hand slept peacefully and well in a very comfortable bed. But it helped when I sampled some of the lovely wine from the bar. Overall lovely hotel and well worth a stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel very convenient to termini, within easy walking distance”
Reviews.Author: dianej43
Reviews.Content: Bedroom we had was on 6th floor and very quiet and comfortable. Breakfast was continental but cereals, yoghurt,fruit juices, boiled egg and toast as well as an italian cake at hand as well. Could not fault the hotel for helpfulness. The wine in the evening was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: carms2202
Reviews.Content: The San Remo is a typical Rome hotel, situated close to the termini and within walking distance to all the major attractions. Rome is a fanastic city and the San Remo is a hotel of adequate standard to make your trip a good one. Breakfast is good enough to set you up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: mariagrace1952
Reviews.Content: I was put off by the negitive reviews,so wasnt expecting much.I was wrong the staff were friendly and helpful.They even put up with our attempts to speak the language.The water was strange ,the fact that you had to run it for quite a while before in went hot,it just meant you brushed your tooth with the shower running,then had your shower.The best thing about it was that it was close to all transport,bus,tram and undergound.For one euro you can go anywhere in the city.I would be happy to stay there again.At the end of the day all you need is somewhere to sleep thats clean,and it was.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Razor59
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried by the negative reviews, so pleasantly surpised by the hotel when we arrived. Don't believe all that's written in the bad/poor reviews. If you're on a budget and can't afford a 5 star hotel for a few nights, this is a pretty good choice of hotel. I think some people want to pay for a 1 star hotel and get a 5 star hotel!! We arrived about 8pm at the hotel after a 5 or 6 minute walk from the railway station. The young lady behind the recpetion desk was very polite, helpful, spoke pretty good english, and even knew my name. (I guess we were the only people who had not checked in that day). The hotel itself was clean and tidy. Our room was on the 6th floor and the lift soon whisked us up there. The room was big enough for what we wanted with plenty of room to hang clothes in the wardrobe and put the other bits in the drawers and on the shelves. The room was clean with a large bed. The bathroom was a bit small but it was adequate for getting showered and washed etc, it's not like you spend your holiday in the bathroom. There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the bedrooms but coffee etc can be purchased at the bar and taken to your room. Breakfast was continental and a help yourself affair with a good selection to start the day. The hotel was in a brilliant location, all the main sights and attractions were within walking distance. We only caught the Metro once and that was to go to the Vatican, but walked back to the hotel later in the day. There was also a good selection of reasonably priced restaraunts close by the hotel. The area around the hotel was okay, some reviews say that people were worried at night but I have to say we did not get that feeling. There are so many people about late into the night that the streets are never deserted. The only thing really to warn about is the pick-pockets at the major sights and the railway station (Roma Termini). All in all good value for money, not the 5 star hotel we all crave, but clean, tidy, central and close to all the sights. Looking forward to going back again.

Reviews.Title: “one of the poorest areas of rome”
Reviews.Author: rhianna86
Reviews.Content: pleasant greeting on arrival although we were a little concerned as to why they wanted to keep our passport ( to photocopy - got it back within 5 mins) The reception staff were mostly very helpful. Hotel could do with a little lick of paint but o.k if you are just looking for somewhere to get your head down. Breakfast...not bad but only offer continental. Hotel is in a great location with all main attractions close by. Bar always appears to be closed but if you ask for a drink the staff will fetch you one. No iron available when asked and nocoffee making facilities in the room, not good for a coffee lover but we know this is due to them not drinking instant coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but, not great.”
Reviews.Author: stuart1980bull
Reviews.Content: The location is, good, just a few streets from the main train station, tour buses, and taxi rank, with two, metro stations a five minutes walk. So far so good, when you arrive at the Hotel, all looks, good the lobby area is well presented, the staff were help full, and check in, went well. The problems are mainly with the room, mold and damp on walls and windows. The bathroom was terrible, hair and rust in the shower,a dirty floor, and during our stay we only got one loo roll, and no fresh towels. We have stayed in many places around the world, and have found this to be the worst bathroom. It's a shame if they just sorted the bathroom, issues out then this Hotel would be great.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: OZTravelers10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely disgusting, i would never stay here again. The lobby looks o.k but once you get past that is all goes down hill. When we walked in the room there were dirty marks all up the walls, the linen didn't look very clean, and the bathroom was mouldy and you never felt clean after a shower. We didn't have any hot water the whole 4 nights we were there and when i complained the girl on the front desk just shrugged her shoulders.

Reviews.Title: “3* value with great location and good facilities”
Reviews.Author: steve-ajg
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greeted with the usual italian, polite but not over friendly reception. We had requested extra bed in room as we are a family of four and expected 'put you ups' but were pleasantly suprised to have a top floor family room with two bedrooms and four proper beds (Room 609). Location is walking distance of station and just off main street of via Nazianale, central to all tourist attractions. To sum up, on a 3* budget this hotel was perfect for our family, including kids of 14 & 9, as a base to tour the beautiful city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: todls
Reviews.Content: We had to plan a trip to Rome with short notice to attend an event at the Vatican. Budget was a concern since it was short notice and we didn't have a lot of time to daudle with looking for a place. We chose the San Remo based on price point, location, reviews and the pictures. Also, the airline offered it as a choice so we figured it should be okay. It was perfectly adequate. The hotel was very clean. The room was a nice size and faced the front of the hotel so we overlooked the street. That was not a problem- hardly any traffic went by. In fact we both commented how it was unusal how little traffic there was. The bath was bigger than usual. The only thing I had to do for hot water in the morning was start the shower and let it run for a few minutes before the hot water would flow. It was HOT went it came. The beds were fine. Not fancy mattresses like "select comfort" kinds of things but were just fine for us. Plenty of storage and room stow the lugage out of the way. Breakfast was as expected, rolls, breads, cereals, coffees etc. Every morning we smelled bread baking so I assume most, if not all, was baked fresh in house. The desk staff was always cordial and helpful. We had to check out early, before breakfast hours, and we were offered a "brown bag" breakfast with a pastry, juice, water, and toasts to take with. That was nice to have on the Leonardo Express to the airport. There is free computer use in the lobby but you have to get a password from the desk. It is very handy to Termini and the Metro. All in all, if you want simple,clean comfortable acommodations, the San Remo will satisfy. I would stay again. As with any recommendation I make,I always cnsider the known tastes of the person(s) asking. So I know some people who would not like it and others who be fine with it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: RJB007
Reviews.Content: My travel agent booked this hotel for me, I did go through some reviews before saying yes to the travel agent. The hotel is strategically located in city center in 1 of the narrow streets. A small desk reception fully decorated with leaflets for city tours. After check-in, I found the room big enough and clean but the promised room-bar was empty. Toilet was clean and tidy. The breakfast in morning was simply a formality with breads, eggs, some meat, tea, coffee, etc. So you just basically oblige (I don't know yourself or hotel staff). The best part of the hotel is it's location. You step out in the evening and forget everything else. There are so many restaurants around, they put up tables, etc for dinner on the side walks. Some people would play music on different instruments, you can tip one of them to play a private no. for you. I loved being here in the evenings with a glass of wine and some delicious food. Over and all, it was not bad deal.

Reviews.Title: “I would like to say how much I enjoyed our stay.........but I can't”
Reviews.Author: binky2712
Reviews.Content: To call this hotel basic would be generous. The room had no pictures on the walls, not even a bedside light! There were dirty marks on the walls and a section of plaster broken away. The bathroom was no better and there was no hot water. Breakfast was very poor, all drinks came from vending machines, even the fruit juice(which tasted like sherbert). The location was up a drab side street although quite close to some of the main attractions. We won't be going back to what should be no more than 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “We would not recommend this hotel to anybody”
Reviews.Author: Citytripper49
Reviews.Content: The attitude of the reception staff ranged from off-hand to downright rude. Despite requests from numerous guests, the bar was never opened during our entire stay. The room was drab and hot water was not always available.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bobsgirlNorthampton
Reviews.Content: I'd read some dodgy reviews about this hotel, so I wasn't really looking forward to it, and when I saw it in this little side street I thought the worst. However, I was pleasantly surprised! We arrived 2hrs before check-in time, but they allowed us up to the room. The air conditioning doesn't blast out at you, but it's perfectly adequate. The room (and bathroom) was very clean and the beds were comfortable. We were so tired on the first night that I just fell asleep as soon as I lay down, so didn't bother with the extra pillows. When we came back from our 2nd day of sightseeing, the extra pillows had been taken away! The floor is smooth wood-effect, not carpeted, so it's cooler on your feet. Very nice for people like me who found it hard to cope with the overall heat of the city. Breakfast was at a very civilised time and although the hotel was quite full we didn't have to wait at all. You get a great choice too, and the tables are cleared pretty much as soon as you leave, without the nice lady "hovering" or pouncing as soon as you push your chair back. I love the tradition (is it an Italian thing?) of putting little pots on the table for putting your rubbish in. The staff were very helpful and there was plenty of basic info in the lobby for tourists. The hotel didn't serve evening meals, but that wasn't a problem as there is a restauant about 20 yards down the road, with plenty more just around a couple of corners. We had a small balcony off our room, so we spent some time just people watching - it's a very well-used street. The terminii is literally just up the road, where you can catch the Metro or a mainline train. And one of the "hop-on, hop-off" bus tour stops is at the top of the street. When you visit Rome, all you really need a hotel for is somewhere to sleep and eat breakfast - I'd have no hesitation about staying here again. One really annoying thing about Rome is the amount of people trying to sell you hats, parasols, cheap shiny jewellery, roses etc. At least in the hotel we were safe from them! oh - one last thing - there was a small fridge in the room, with 4 bottles of water in. When we checked out we discovered that this was actually the mini-bar, so we were charged for the 2 bottles we'd had. There was nothing in the room to tell us that this was a mini bar - we just thought it was a courtesy thing, as there were no tea & coffee making facilities. We didn't realise at the time that the Italians don't seem to do that!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but fine”
Reviews.Author: Joey83
Reviews.Content: Very close to the Termini station and walkable to all the main attractions but also close to the metro if your feet need a rest! Room was fairly dark and basic but did the job. Breakfast was very busy but worth the wait for the fresh pastries and cakes and bread etc. The reception were helpful and funny and gave us a very good map to help us. The direct area around the station fwlt quite dodgy and there is no need to go there really unless it is actually for the train. This was 14 Euros each for a clean, safe direct train from the airport to the station and easily done on the return too.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: valerieinleeds
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from the San Remo. I was apprehensive after reading bad reviews however was pleasantly surprised. We had room 216 which was a spacious twin room and had a balcony you could sit out on. The hotel is not 5 star but is perfectly adequate for what we wanted, I even left the large windows open at night and yes there was some traffic noise but nothing so bad you couldn't get to sleep. The breakfast is a continental breakfast and there is a lot of choice. We were in Rome last year but only for 6 hours and we only managed to visit the collosseum, we returned this year to see the things we didn't have time for last time. We enjoyed our stay and all I have to add it don't believe the bad things about the hotel. It is perfectly situated for the termini, there are plenty of places to eat. Go with an open mind and enjoy your stay, we have no complaints about the hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: kperdue
Reviews.Content: Great location for this hotel, very close to Termini station. Clean rooms, quiet hallways. Attentive and helpful staff. I traveled with my two young children and the Quad room was large by Rome standards. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “all round excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: haylzmonty89
Reviews.Content: this hotel was easy to find from the main central termini, as it was literally across the road and took 2 mins to find. met by friendly and welcoming staff who were nothing but accomadating. the room was more than we expected, as it provided ample privacy and also spacious and well maintained. For me i am a very picky eater, as i have prefernces to certain meats etc. but for this hotel i found i was able to eat a varied breakfast every morning, which ranged from eggs, cereals, breads, teas, coffees, juices, yoghurts, fruits etc. all of which was amazing and very well presented by staff and teh dining room was extremely well kept, being tidied by catering staff. the main purpose of this holiday was to celebrate my 21st birthday, and as student in History. Rome was my number one holday destination, as i wanted see as many sites as possible in the short time i was staying. the hotel proved to be perfect for this. it was located central to everything. the tour bus departed from the end of the street, which was hop on hop off and proved effective for getting a sense of direction around the town. we stayed on the bus up to the vatican, we hopped off and seen what we needed to see there before hopping back on again. when we were back to the centre we were then able to find the trevi fountain, colosuem and spanish steps were within a 20 minute walk of our hotel. its location proved so good that we even found that one of the top ten sites of rome was literally situated right behind the hotel, the saint maggiore church. which is said to rival that of saint peter's basilica. it was amazing. there were plenty of local pizzeria's to eat at for lunch, dinner, and even a couple of chinese restaurants which were lovely. DO NOT go to the McDonalds, they are majorly overpriced, it worked out with exchange rate that you would end up paying £8 for a big mac on its own.... we travelled on 13th - 17th march 2010, we were prepared for showers, but upon arrival we were met with nothing but sun and only needed light cardigans for the night as it did get chilly but nothing they could not handle. overall i would recommend this hotel to anyone onshort break to city, as its location is perfectly situated for sight seeing and also getting away from hussle and bussle of city life.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel near station good base for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: smartesthorse
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within easy walking distance of the TERMINII station which is for trains and buses. It is in a quiet side street and despite hearing rumours that the area round the station was 'dodgy' I felt perfectly safe. The hotel looks posher in reception than it actually is, the rooms are clean the plumbing quirky but functional but this is not a hotel for a romantic weekend or for lounging about in. It is built in a square round a small court so most rooms are inward looking and VERY dark. I got what I wanted a base to sleep and shower in and watch a bit of TV in the evening, there is nothing about the place to make you want to stay in That said it is it what. it is and its much cheaper than plusher places with a view. Eating out in the evenings is a bit problematical there arent many nices cafes or restaurants in the immediate vicinity so be prepared to bus in to the middle..The Centro Storico has loads of places look for Via Corso. Breakfast is an acceptable continental buffet with so-so coffee out of a machine It is all clean well managed friendly and an ideal base to explore the rest of the city

Reviews.Title: “Good space”
Reviews.Author: BetoC
Reviews.Content: Good space in the room. Good bed, refrigerator, roomy closet, regular breakfast and treatment of people, that speaks in english too. It's near to Termini station (subway, reagular bus, touristical bus and train station). The only con I have feaced in Paris too: tiny shower place, even in a roomy restroom. There was a little leak in our restroom but that not afect the judjement severely. Even next to train station, is not near to Rome downtown, but touristical bus ensures you go back there (untill 8 P.M., after that only by regular bus, subway, depending from where you come, taxi or on foot).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for city break”
Reviews.Author: susieq2010
Reviews.Content: our family spent a very enjoyable three day break at the hotel,after reading some reviews I was a little anxious about the hotel but was delighted with it ,the rooms were basic but spotless, there were clean towels everyday,the breakfast was plentiful and the staff were very nice.would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “perfert location, clean and friendlt hotel.”
Reviews.Author: carolynTWarrington
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a weekend break staying at the hotel San Remo i Rome. I booked a cheap deal with Jet2 flying from Manchester. I had read the reviews on trip advisor and wasn't sure about where I was going to end up, but me and my mum had a fab time. Jet2 fligh into T3 in rome and it is dead easy to get the Leonardo express train that runs every 1/2 hour to the main train station- Termini. The ticket is 11 euro each way per person but make sure you get the ticket "validated" in the yellow machines before you get on the train. Once validated the ticket will last 90 mins. Once in the, termini, the hotel is Off Via Carfour the staff were friendly and helpful. The room as clean and basic, a clean bathroom and lots of clean towels. The air con. was a bit dodgy tho. The breakfast was adequate and kept us gonig till tea time ( with the exception of an occassional ice cream or cake!). A good tip when eating out i to ask for the drinks price list, many places just show the food list, but charge a small fortune for drinks, some places charge 9.50 euro for a large beer!! We found a great little place called" Nuova-Stella" onVia Manin, 54-58, fresh home cooked meals for around 8euro per person, but more importantly, the house wine was 10 euro per bottle- that's cheap. Franko was the main guy- very friendly. The sites: well worth getting a guide for each area you go to, we had guides for the Colosseum, forum and Palatne Hill. the guides bring the Roman times back to life and are well worth the money- around 20 euro- seniors are free. The Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Trevi fountain and the Spanish Steps are all close together to walk between. Note that the Vaticanmuseums are closed on public and religious holidays- as we found out going on Palm Sunday!! Overall we had a great city break- oh, also, not many public toilets in Rome, go in your hotel and in the cafe's or resteraunts you visit!! For a cheap break, I would defo. go again- cheap but adequate-oh, and don't get drinks from the hotel, they will cost you 6 euro for a small short each. Happy holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property”
Reviews.Author: themanc37
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed for 4 nights in March and could not fault the hotel at all. Upon arrival the reception staff were friendly and helpful, as were all the staff we came into contact with. Location-wise, the property is ideal. Close to the main train station and metro stop, its so easy to find your way around. Its also well within walking distance of the Colosseum, trevi fountain and most sights. The room we had was 216, which had a nice balcony, good sized room and bathroom. The cleaners came in every day to keep it spotless and tidy. The room we had was nicely furnished and bright, so could not find fault at all. Some people had told us that the termini area was a bit dodgy. We did not find it like that at all. Its wasn't the most attractive area, but certainly it did not put us off. Breakfast at the hotel was more than adequate. Plenty of pastries, cereals, fruit ad cakes every morning. No doubt some 'Brits' would complain of a lack eggs, bacon, beans etc, but if you accept what is there you will be fine. Overall, a brilliant little hotel. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: tamer1
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel this was.It's just 5 minutes walk from termini station and is close to all the major attractions,such as spanish steps,the trevi fountain and etc.A nice clean,good located hotel.I would defiently stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: baznoble1
Reviews.Content: A comfortable clean hotel just 200 yards from the main rail/bus/metro stations. The night receptionist was less than welcoming, everyone else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable and pleasant stay at the San Remo”
Reviews.Author: GentlemanHellraiser
Reviews.Content: A group of 6 of us boys made up of my best friends and I stayed at the Sam Remo back in December 2008 for 4 nights for my 19th birthday. The hotel itself is in a fantastic location. It is about a 2 minute stroll form the Termini, which is Romes main train station. We got to many of the cities best site from here, and you can buy a train ticket for 1 euro, which last for 75 mins, and enable you to travel anywhere in Rome for that duration. It is also located about 10 mins walk away from the Colleseum, whci is spectactular, but not worth goin inside of it, just to observe from the outside. The nigth life is great in Rome, it is dotted full of uni bars, with very loud American students inhabiting them, which is always a source of entertainment! I especially recomend Scholars. the breakfast at the hotel is ok at best in all honesty, most days we dined round the corner for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Rome is quite expensive for eating out, but its the best meal you would ever eat..i assure you!! The staff at the San remo are very helpful and speak very good Englidh and can help you with regards to tours etc. the maids always keep the rooms clean and tidy. Tips were never discussed and not neccessary. Rome is awsome for young and old, but there is only one mcdonalds in Rome.....THANK GOD!! So if you do not have a discernign palete do not go...Rome is all about food and wine....thats what i call a fantastic break!!!

Reviews.Title: “Its 3 star but adequate”
Reviews.Author: Peterrich
Reviews.Content: The San Remo Hotel in Rome is a 3 star hotel, I read the reports on this hotel before we went, and was little unsure, when we arrived we were greeted and made very welcome, the outside of the hotel looked a bit drab, it was not light up although it had lights positioned outside. We were shown to our room, which turned out to be quite small and sparse, two single beds, a plastic chair, a flat screen tv which it was impossible to get a decent picture from any channel on. the bathroom had a toilet, sink, shower and a bidet, the walls above the shower had mould on them and the ceiling was flaking. The bathroom apart from that was clean, the was no evidence of cracked tiles as previously reported, the towels and flannels were clean and fresh, the toilet flush left something to be desired, and the taps were a bit old fashioned. Overall the room was clean, but very small, one thing we realised after the the first night the heating/air-con had a mind of its own, and we ended up throwing nearly all the covers off, this was remedied by the next night having the window wide open, in January!!!!. In the morning got up for breakfast, continental style again adequate but not cordon bleu, something which I will mention later the Italians cannot seem to make decent coffee, so we settled for the hot chocolate, incidentally all drinks came out of a machine, so work it out for yourselves. The bar was a bit of a shambles certainly not the place you would want to spend an evening, plus cokes at 4 Euros each seemed a bit pricey. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful and spoke good English. The hotel was very well situated to enable the tourist to take full advantage of sightseeing in Rome about 300 metres from the main railway terminal and virtually the same from the tour buses starting point. Rome itself has loads going for it we were only there for 3 days and one of those was taken up with a trip to Anzio to visit a relatives war grave, incidentely the cost by rail to travel to Anzio a one hour train journey was 3.20 Euros no this was not a mistake 3.20 per person each way, the trains were clean inside with plenty of seats double deckers, and always on time, the staff at the railway terminal very helpful and probably used to dealing with idiot tourists who not speak Italian, whilst on the subject of the railway they are the best way to get from the airport to the centre of Rome at 11 Euros per person, dont get bullied at the airport by shuttle bus drivers telling you they can do it cheaper and better, they cant! As mentioned earlier the best way to see the sites of Rome is by open top tourist bus, the one I recommend is " Rome Cristinana" at 16 euros for 24 hrs on/off also they have fold away roofs when it rains (which it did most of the we were there), you will also be assailed by brolly salesmen, who seem to be every third person you come across with prices ranging from 3 euros to 10 depending how hard it rains. Rome sites: do not miss St Peters Basillica, absolutely unbelieveable, we did not have time to queue to see the Cistine Chapel unfortunatley, we were a little dissapointed with the Colosseum, as we had previously see the one in Tunsia which is bigger and more complete, (where they filmed Gladiator) and it cost 12 Euros each to go around it, but all you can do walk around the walls on two levels. We also did the Trevi Fountains and Spanish Steps, mind you it is a bit off putting to see Roman Soldiers standing around using mobiles and smoking while in designer track suit bottoms. Take a walk down the Via Nationale towards the Colosseum and you will pass the forums very interesting. Beware of crossing roads a zebra crossing is not a safety zone once you are off the pavement you become a legitamate target , the Roman motorists treat tourists as big game, not funny. If you like coffee as I do you will disappointed in Rome apart from being expensive, the taste ranges from mud to bottled water. One place we ate at was the "Hard Rock Cafe" the food was good and resonable, and not too noisy, with good staff, we also did the usual Pasta and PIzza, nothing special but then perhaps we went to wrong places, we tried to choose the ones that had a lot people in them. Overall I enjoyed my short break in Rome, would I go back? I would not rush back and if I did I would research my hotels better and go in better weather, mind you saying that the queues would be longer for the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Trouble!”
Reviews.Author: myviewonyou
Reviews.Content: It looks like there are some complains involving money. Mine does too. My overall stay was fine until I later found out that I was charged twice for my stay. I contacted the hotel and at first, they accused me of being wrong. Only when I insisted did they look through their transactions and true enough, they charged me twice. They told me to contact my credit card company so that my credit card company could notify them about charging me twice. ermmmm, if I'm not mistaken, I thought the hotel already knew they charged me twice??? Well, I contacted the credit card company and as usual, will have to go true soooo much trouble for the mistake made by the hotel. The point I'm trying to make here is that at no time at all did Hotel San Remo offer any kind of assistance. The credit card company even advised me that an easier way would be for the hotel to just refund me the money directly as they have already received the payment, TWICE! I contacted the hotel again on the matter and the staff could not be bothered at all and still insisted that they would only make a refund once they received a call from the bank. He even argued rudely with me saying that I am wasting my time calling the hotel and should call the credit card company instead. What ever happen to the saying 'the customer is always right'. It is clear that i will never ever stay in this hotel again (unless i want to risk being put though all this trouble again).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Emzy19
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the San Remo with my partner for 3 nights from 13th-16th Nov, we really enjoyed our stay and would visit again. It does amuse me how some people seem to think they will get everything for nothing...for the price we paid we thought it was fab. The hotel is basic but very clean, take into consideration how little time you do actually spend there! We used the hotel for sleeping at night and that was it. Location was excellent, literally a couple minutes walk from the main Termini station which the centre for all public transport in Rome. You can get a train from and to the airport costing 11 euros each way, you can also purchase travel tickets which are 1 euro for one trip or 4 euros for a whole day, this applies to the metro and buses which we thought was great value. That said, you can do most of Rome by foot, the hotel is within walking distance of all the main sites; we just used the metro towards the end of our trip when our feet were aching too much!! So back to the hotel.... We found the staff to be very courteous and friendly, particuarly the reception staff, who always looked up, smiled and said hello as we passed, and were always happy to answer any questions we had about the city or the hotel itself. Rooms were fine, cleaned everyday, our only complaint was the two twin beds pushed together to form a double, though you get this most places. When we arrived we discovered the fitting that fixed the shower head to the wall was broken, we mentioned this to the girl on reception when we were going out, and when we came back it had been fixed. We thought the breakfast was perfectly acceptable, just your standard continental breakfast with croissants, rolls, toast, biscuits, fruit, cereals, eggs, cold meats, cheese, coffee, tea and juices. I don't understand why so many people have complained about this?! There are plenty of restaurants and cafes surrounding the hotel, which offer lovely food at reasonable prices. You will pay more if you choose to eat near the sites as you pay for the view, therefore eat in some of the smaller restaurants off the beaten track- they're half the price! So to sum up...would I visit Rome again....Yes! And would I stay at the San Remo again....Yes!! Enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: arkaykolkata
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location near the Termini and helpful staff. Overall fine but could improve the light in the dining room which is a bit on the darker side.

Reviews.Title: “Nice locaction, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: berninis-angel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel having spent our honeymoon there,and really wished we picked a different hotel. Firstly we thought the hotel looked ok from the front and in the reception area, and the female receptionist that checked us in was friendly and helpfull. The lift was tiny for the size of the hotel and very slow, it was actually quicker for us to walk the 10 flights of stairs to our room ok the 5th floor. Our room was of a an average size and quite clean apart from the dodgy air conditioning unit above the door and the absolutely disgusting shower head. We would advise anybody that is thinking of stopping here not to leave any lose change in your room, as regardless of wether you want it or not the house keeping staff will take it. We had left money on the table for drinks we had taken from the mini bar, as a reminder for us to pay for them on check out which it stated on the price list, after a nice day out we returned to find the room had been cleaned but also that the money had been taken!! We checked with reception if housekeeping had handed the money in to cover the mini bar bill and they informed us they hadn't. Our biggest complaint however is the fact that we could of missed our flight home due to the incompetence and bare faced lies from a male member of reception staff. We experienced problems trying to reconfirm our airport transfer for our return flight, so we asked the man at reception if he could help us. He tried ringing the number while we were there but no one was answering so he told us to leave it with him and he would sort it out and confirm our transfer. After a lovely day sight seeing when given our room key we were handed our paper work and told that our pick up had been confirmed for the next day at 4pm. The following day 4pm came and went, no airport transfer turned up we had to phone the uk emergency number to see what was going on. We were told that nobody had contacted the company to confirm our pick up so we were not on the list. This came as quite a suprise as the reception staff had assured us it had been confirmed, and had even written this on our paper work. If you wish to stay at a hotel that has dirty shower heads your money grows legs of its own and told bare faced lies by the staff, then by all means stay here we certianly wont be staying here again and are in the process of making an official complaint through our travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in centre of rome”
Reviews.Author: travellers100uk
Reviews.Content: ignore the bad reviews on this hotel.we went in sept the rooms were spotless and cleaned every day.the breakfast was continental and plenty of choice.the staff all spoke english and were always happy to help with any questions.if on a short trip we suggest a tour on the open top bus the red 110 buses are good but there are others to choose from.the hotel is near the main railway station but note trains to airport leave from platform 25 not 24.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel.....horrible breakfeast”
Reviews.Author: nortiga
Reviews.Content: Clean and big room, with elevator and airconditioned, good service, good location (next to Termini and quick walk to the Colosseum and main atractions). Very bad breakfeast.....

Reviews.Title: “Wine alley .. a haunt for the Rome's homeless and dispossessesd. One to be avoided!”
Reviews.Author: bellissimomare
Reviews.Content: Let's begin with the positives! Hotel San Remo is located around 400 meters from Termini Station, and is a 5 minute walk from Via Nazionale, the main thoroughfare when travelling on foot in the direction of the Vatican and other major attractions. The staff were mainly very pleasant and polite, especially one young lady on reception who took every chance she could to practice her English language skills on myself and my partner! The entrance lobby (inside) is very clean and quite elegant, and the breakfast served was adequate. Internet access is available free of charge upon request of a required token, and buys you around an hour of usage. Our room was on the 4th floor, and may as well have been on the roof for all the use it was. Initially very clean, our 4 days spent there were replete with reminders by ourselves to reception to ask housekeeping to actually come along and clean, something which just wasn't happening! On the 3rd time of asking, we just gave up and begun taking towels and soaps from the openly available/discarded housekeeping cart on our floor and tidied as we went along. Our room was also decorated with a toilet that can only be described as someone's science project, and which must have wakened the dead when flushed during the night. The sound resembled a freight train passing through, and was unmatched for volume except for a collection of garrulous bimbos whose constant nighttime chatter emanated from a nearby room. A 30 minute refill for the cistern heightened the experience and made sure we remained bright and alert during the night. Tastefully crumbling plasterwork and bonding around the shower, accentuated by a rusting shower-head and broken floor tiles completed the look of the room. The previous guest's body hair smeared along the shower tiling were an especially welcome and thoughtful addition. We also appeared to have been placed where there was a minimum of soundproofing available. Staying in room 409, we could actually enjoy the late night conversations of those airhead bimbos staying 3 rooms along. Constantly engaged in mindless babble about Yoorp (we took that to mean Europe), guys, moms, dads, and "like our totally miserable allowance. I mean, duh!"; and extolling the virtues of some "condo in Malibu", they must have been using their room hairdryer to stay warm at night, as it remained on so long. Either that, or it was Rapunzel and her North American airhead sisters staying in that room. Chapping their door drew silence, which was something the staff had stated they would do, and never ever did. My only wish was that Dr Lecter might be placed next door to them, and I wouldn't have had to silence them on each never-ending night of our hideous stay. Alarmingly, there was a real problem with homeless persons living rough in the vicinity of the hotel. I was really shocked to find 4 of them living in archways either immediately next to the hotel entrance doorway, or right across the street. These poor people had absolutely nothing of their own, and both myself and partner found ourselves switching immediately to our professional heads and either talking with them or taking one of them for some food. It was heartbreaking to behold and worrying that in a city of such profound wealth, there is such untold misery so commonplace. Where this relates to Hotel San Remo, is that the hotel appears to be used as a urinal by some of the homeless persons, and perhaps late night revellers we hadn't seen after dark; but nonetheless it is the responsibility of the staff to get out and clean their own doorstep. It absolutely stinks and was completely offensive. In fact, Rome was generally very badly smelly and it's a problem we discovered in Florence too. Urinating in public must have become something of a passtime for Romans and Florentines of late. To sum up, I'd choose this hotel if I truly had nowhere else to go. Appearing initially stylish, you'll quickly learn that despite the best efforts of the reception staff, this tatty hovel holds the appeal of a paper cut and the style of a bread van. It's the ultimate in sham chic. Mutton dressed as, well, mutton. Sleep there if you can bear the noise of the many idiots this place seems to attract, and get the heck out of there at first light and don't return until you're so exhausted you won't care if there's a herd of birthing camels in the next room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome .... and Hotel as well...”
Reviews.Author: amkrn67
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located . Everything within walking distance. Felt totally safe walking in area at night .

Reviews.Title: “Nice and good value”
Reviews.Author: lovejumping
Reviews.Content: I got an excellent rate for this hotel and i was surprised and impressed therefore by just how nice this place was, its a great location far enough from the station to avoid crowds noise etc but still only a 5 min walk, nice clean overall appearance marble stairs etc and no complaints about the room or breakfast which was spot on.The guy at the reception was ok too friendly and helpful. I just could not see how anyone could post a negative response about this place especially when you consider the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, awesome city! :)”
Reviews.Author: pinklady912
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from this hotel and I have to say, it was absolutely fantastic! No, it's not a 4 or 5* hotel, and anyone who books it shouldn't expect it to be so. However, for the money you pay, you get a comfy bed for the night, a filling breakfast and by far one of the best hotel locations in Rome! It's a five minute walk from Termini Station and the bus station, so you can get pretty much anywhere in Rome within 20 minutes by metro or bus! Having read reviews before I went, I know a lot of people have complained about the area. Well, we were 2 young ladies on our own and we felt perfectly safe! Overall, Rome is amazing and I would certainly stay at the San Remo again when I return!

Reviews.Title: “City oasis”
Reviews.Author: funkyanorak
Reviews.Content: The hotel San Remo is a city centre hotel situated in in the quiet Via D'azeglio very convenient for Rome Termini Station, bus network and city tours. It has a welcoming lobby with reception desk. An arch leads through to a marble staircase and a hallway containing the lift and a secure baggage store, useful if your transport isn't until the evening. The English speaking staff on the front desk and the house staff are very helpful and pleasant. Breakfast is taken in a large room adjacent to the bar/lounge and the choice is extensive, including continental selection, pastries, cereal, fresh fruit, cooked meats, cheeses, juices and coffee. Serving platters were readily replenished as breakfast progressed. If you require an evening meal, there is a choice between an excellent bar and a busy restaurant both just around the corner. The San Remo's bedrooms are impeccably clean, tastefully decorated, comfortable and an oasis of quiet from bustling Rome city. Our room had an LCD TV, but the signal was weak on most channels. During our stay the fire alarm sounded on our floor at around 7am one morning. There was a half-hearted evacuation down the stairs with people in night attire mixing with guests intent on an early breakfast. Thankfully, the front desk confirmed that it was a false alarm! The San Remo is a good class hotel in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant break in rome”
Reviews.Author: Eavan
Reviews.Content: We spent four days in march in San Remo-we were on6 floor -no street noise and no paper-thin walls-bathroom fine -great location-perfectly adequate breakfast and very pleasant breakfast lady-rates good for 3 star-2 comfy armchairs in room would have made it a 4 star for us-but then we were paying 3 star prices!-we would return

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, close to main attractions!!!”
Reviews.Author: ekimmanley
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hotel San Remo. We stayed 3 nights after a short stay in Madrid. The rooms where basic and clean. There is a flat screen tv and a mini bar. The front desk staff is very helpful and speak fluent English. The hotel is very close to The Termini train station, and walking distance to several cafes and stores. The metro system is very easy to use, and can get you most anywhere within Rome. I would say if you are looking for a cozy place to stay, within walking distance to the train station, this is a great hotel!!! We would def stay again, hopefully sooner than later!

Reviews.Title: “Normal hotel with the terrible shower”
Reviews.Author: Annette495
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel on May 2009 with my family and friends. San Remo is absolutely standart hotel, which is located in 15-minutes walking way to the center of Rome. Staff in the hotel was very friendly. Breakfast was normal and tasty. Our room was quite large for three-star city hotel, maybe because we had triple accommodation. But it was just one point, which really disappointed us - there was the terrible uncomfortable shower in our room and in our friend's room too - it is not very important, but we felt discomfort in using such shower. But we are absolutely satisfied with this hotel and I can recommend it to you!

Reviews.Title: “Clean quiet hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: DavidFromOttawa
Reviews.Content: The hotel has 7 floors, with about 10 rooms per floor. There is nice a granite staircase with Roman statues, plus a tiny elevator. The rooms are small as one expects in Europe, and have been recently renovated. The floors are wood grain (probably laminate) and the walls are neatly painted. The bathrooms are tiled on the walls and floor, with modern fixtures. The shower is tiny but useable with plenty of hot water. The single bed is comfortable and the linens crisp and clean. There is a small desk and chair, a place to open a suitcase, a closet, and a full wall mirror over the bed. The windows are new aluminum framed with double glass to isolate the noise, and could be fully opened to get some ventilation. There is an air conditioning unit in the ceiling, but as far as I could tell had not been turned on yet (April-May). I had a room that faced into the open central area, so there was absolutely no traffic noise. I could hear other people talking in their rooms through the open window, but it was extremely quiet. Wireless internet is 20 euros per day. Staff was very friendly. I received a friendly Buon Giorno from everyone, almost like on a cruise ship. The front desk helped me with opera tickets. On my last day after checkout, after the breakfast was closed, I asked if I could get a coffee. The desk clerk brought me into the breakfast room, and I was given a coffee and two croissants.
