The location is about 3 minutes from Stazione Termini, Rome’s central train station, which is why I chose the hotel. This central location gets you easily to the parts of Rome that you want to see. There is a direct train from the airport and to other cities, and a metro station on lines A and B. The station has cafeterias, ATM’s, and a number of stores. You are a few blocks from the opera house, and a few kilometres from central Rome. I used the hop-on/hop-off bus to get around for a few days, starting at Termini. The metro is easy to use, either 1 euro per trip or 4 euros per day. The area is in a state of change, with upscale hotels and restaurants, and a few slightly shady areas. There were a couple of street people opposite the hotel. During the day there are plenty of business people walking around, but at night one should be a bit careful. It is better to follow Via Cavour south for two blocks from Termini, then take Via Principe Amedeo one block west; the hotel will be around the corner on your left. At night, the plaza in front of Termini is full of young people, but I don’t think they were interested in hassling tourists. The hotel offered the usual continental breakfast, with meats, cheese, yoghurt and breads. And a coffee maker that produced acceptable caffe latte. I liked the hotel so much that I stayed there on my return trip from Naples. My second room was very much like my first, and I had a great sleep. The only thing missing is a safe in the room; you could get a small locker in the luggage storage room, but I did not feel safe leaving my passport there. I paid CAD$146 per night (USD$124, 92 euros) prepaid on Expedia.ca. On my return, I paid 65 euros for one night, so I guess I overpaid on Expedia. For a central location in a large European city, I think this was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good - clean, but nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: travelcouple-0
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good. Nothing fancy, very basic. The shower was tiny - which actually became funny at one point. It is noisy, but all the hotels we've visited in Italy were noisy. It's a hotel, not a rock walled castle. It only becomes noisy in the mornings and evenings. We barely heard street noise, it's the other guests' noise. It was clean, never saw bugs or anything like that and the breakfast was pretty good; croissants, nutella (!!), coffee, tea, hot chocolate (which you don't see often), toast - bread, cakes, meat, cheese, juices.... If you get pretty hungry in the mornings, be creative and make yourself a ham and cheese croissant sandwich - pretty good followed by a nutella filled croissant! -Gained lots of pounds in Italy! ;) Bottom line, good hotel, not for the folks looking for elegance but for the ones looking for a clean, safe place to stay in Rome. Close to attractions - 20 minute walk from Trevi Fountain. Right across from train station. Free internet for 1 hour. If you booked, don't worry, it's all good.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccably clean, convenient and hospitable”
Reviews.Author: Canadiantraveller67
Reviews.Content: We stayed in March 2008 in a room on the 4th floor with 2 single beds- the beds were comfortale, our bathroom huge and renovated and the room comfortable. Other than paper thin walls and a little noise (not enough to keep you awake) it wasperfect for tbe great price. Lots of restaurants close by and as promised great location forn sightseeing and transportation. A coupe of pointers- walk from Termini through the terminal when arriving from Leonardo rather than outside. No matter what you are told about phoning North America, a 5 euro phone card from the tabachi is the best bet and works free from the room. Don't try to buy train tickets online from trenitalia from Canada- it is frustrating since the canadian cards do not work- you can book even from the airport but will probably not get the preferred amici ratings. The breakfast was awesome. Happy travellers from Canada

Reviews.Title: “Not even worth 1 star (in stead of 3)”
Reviews.Author: Rometraveler-2009
Reviews.Content: City hotel near Termini station. We were in room 115 in february 2009 for a cultural trip to Rome. If you can cope with : * worn out rooms (loosy electric plugs, fungus on the edges of the bathtub and the ceiling , mutiple reparations of the tub emanel, never cleansed air removal appliance, missing lock on the bathroom door,...) * uninspired breakfast with "fresh" fruit right from the tin can, powder based juice, coffee from a vendor machine, bread that would not pass an independant freshness test * oudoor and indoor noise from 6 am on then we suppose you would be at the right address. A real tourist trap. It's is nothing more than a place to sleep in Rome (a magnificent city by the way), in a dark street of the station area. Advantage : many restaurants nearby. We enjoyed the city but the hotel was literally a cold shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: resjenks
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. I was a single, female traveler and felt safe in this hotel. It was in walking distance of the Coliseum, Forum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, lots of Piazzas. The hotel was clean and I didn't have any trouble with the water heating up. (I read a few reviews where guests listed that problem) The staff spoke fluent English and were very accommodating. There is a great restaurant/bar on the corner near the hotel. The staff there was very friendly. One issue I had was the climate control of heat and air. This problem wasn't bad enough for me not to stay here again. As I said, greatest thing is location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: susmaya
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just a few minutes from Termini station. You dont have to take a taxi, find a map and you´ll find it. Its located on a quiet side street amongs alot of other hotels and a few restaurants. The room was big, bed was comfortable, bathroom was nice and clean. The minibar was not cold but ok. We stayed on the 5 th floor with a view down the street wich was ok. The breakfast buffe was not the greatest, had no eggs and coffe was awful. Staff was polite. San remo is located close to all the major attractions like colosseum, The roman forum, Pantheon ect. Id stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Central but poor...mainly the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: pmg_74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at San Remo for a week, in business and for a weekend break. The room was clean and confortable. The shower had some problems, but it worked... The worst was the breakfast: the orange juice was not orange and the fruit salad mostly had no fresh fruits. People on the reception are kind and speak english. You can also use wireless internet paying 8 Euros per hour (!).

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jalyon
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. It was cheap (by Roman standards) but still had an upscale feel. The rooms were no frills and typically Euro-small, but you're in Rome, so if you're spending much time in the hotel room besides sleeping you're doing something wrong, and they were still perfectably comfortable. The front desk workers are very helpful and speak good English. In the morning they have a great Roman breakfast buffet. By far the best aspect of this hotel is its proximity to transportation. It took us less than 5 minutes to walk to Roma Termini, which is the center of the city's buses, trains, and metro lines. I could walk out the San Remo's front door and be ahywhere in Rome in less than an hour, any of the big tourist spots in 20 minutes. Could not have had a better stay in Rome for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: timperley-trotters
Reviews.Content: Should you be a 1st time visitor to Rome, as we were, this hotel is conveniently located. We arrived at the rail terminal and found it to be a 5 minute walk from there. The train service from the airport runs every 30 minutes and is 11 euros each week. One tip do not forget to validate your ticket in the yellow machines on the platform. Do this before you board the train as you are only allowed 90 minutes from validating the ticket to being timed out. It is within 30 minutes walk of the Forum, Colosseum, Trevi Fountain & Spanish Steps. We had a room on the 6th floor. The lift is very small and only allows 3 persons. Our room was spacious (room 611) and cleaned each day along with a change of towels. The only negative point was the 2 showers were very poor. They shower heads need a good clean. It took about 5 minutes to get the hot water through but once there it was ok. Breakfast choice was more than reasonable and plentiful. At times the breakfast area was over-subscribed and no-one was allowed to sit in the bar area. It would make sense for the hotel management to extend the breakfast area during busy periods. The staff were pleasant and helpful. There are city maps on the desk and other local information leaflets. Our friends did have to wait to have their hairdryer replaced. The ones in the rooms are like mini vacuum cleaners. If you have space ladies, best to take a travel hairdryer. The hotel offers security boxes in a locked room. We found the city to be walkable and did not feel threatened at any time. Some of the back streets are very poorly lit and the roads are cobbled so sensible shoes and perhaps a small torch are recommended. We would suggest visitors have zipped pockets to ensure their credit cards/cash remain safe. There is a small cafe bar/pizzeria called Il Tavolinetto just on the corner (left out of hotel). This is more than adequate for an evening meal and drinks should you arrive back tired at the end of your day. Staff welcoming and its small and cosy. You can sit either outside or inside. Its nothing fancy but prices are reasonable. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “lovely, great location!”
Reviews.Author: LouLiverpool08
Reviews.Content: The San Remo, is great for what you pay, your hardly ever in it when you go to a place like rome. The location is fab, your round the corner about 2-3 minutes away from the termini train station which takes you all over rome, to the airport and the vatican city. If you walk down the road your at all the main sights. I would recommend you get a tour around the Coloseum as it's very interesting. The hotel it's self was reasonable, rooms were fine we asked to be moved because the plumming wasn't working and it wasn't a problem. The breakfasts are lovely too just the normal hotel breakfast so fill up. At the time when we went there was building work going on in the hotel next door, but it didn't disturb us as your up early for your breakfast and out for the whole day. If you get a good deal then I would recommend this hotel and Rome is beautiful. There is a cake shop down the main road which has the most fantastic custard doughnots too. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Winstan88
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located pretty much slap bang in the middle of everything average joe tourist wants to see in Rome and for the sights that were a little further away there was the Metro. The Termini was roughly 2 mins walk from the hotel where you could catch national and local trains, the Metro unlike the London tube is very cool and quite a nice way to travel. The tickets were 1euro and lasted for 75 mins (bought from a machine that has an english setting). Breakfast was OK, Cereal, Pastries, Croissants, Cakes and Toast. The Coffee however was terrible tasted like dishwater, but there was juice available so no big deal really. Staff spoke very good english and were very helpful. The room was a reasonable size, the shower was a little awkward, but I managed to successfully clean myself on every attempt as did my wife. At the end of the day in Rome there is so much to see and do that you don't tend to spend much time in your room. Why are people so concerned about the towels? they were clean and absorbant (the two qualities you look for in a towel!) There was no real outside space here but there are lots of Cafes and bars around to sit in. Be warned though the prices can vary dramatically between neighbouring Restaurants, we found that the key to finding a reasonably priced one was to check the price of their Lager and Wine. We saw prices up to 10 euros for a small 0.2lit glass of Lager and in other places (sometimes neighbouring) they would charge around 5 euros for a medium 0.4 lit glass, all the food was largely a similar price. The hotel is ideal for the budget traveller that still wants a bit of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: KM66027
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Quiet street, good size room, very helpful staff... It is 2 streets from Termini station, so when you have to move your luggage around it is fantastic ! Would definetly stay here again if ever in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy95
Reviews.Content: I like to travel on my own and also for single visitors this proved to be a great hotel. During my first stay in March I asked for a better room which i was given by one of the very kind receptionists the very next day when the room became available for all rooms were occupied. Especially for Italian measures this is really a very good ***-star hotel with a great breakfastbuffet with also very friendly and polite staff! And it's only a 3-minute walk from Termini Station where most busses and all the trains have their departure! On my next trip to Rome I'll certainly go to San Remo Hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for us”
Reviews.Author: AuntLoralie
Reviews.Content: I was so nervous after reading the reviews on this site. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was rather charming. It was definately clean and comfortable. The towels were weird, but they were very clean and absorbant. Breakfast was adequete. There were no eggs or bacon, but actually I never saw a breakfast place anywhere in the city that was like it is in the states. I didn't see one bagel shop either. The staff was okay, they tried to be friendly but I got the impression that they didn't really like us too much. Having never been to rome before, I have nothing to compare it to, but I thought the hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Worth £100 a night - just.”
Reviews.Author: Dan2008Uk
Reviews.Content: After having family members stay at this hotel and reading some encouraging reviews on TripAdvisor I was a little disapointed. The best thing about the San Remo is it's location as it is literally 3 mins walk from Termini Metro Station where the two underground lines intersect, meaning you have cheap and quick access to most areas of the city. We were disapointed in our room, number 315. The mirror was cracked, a large untidy patch of new un-painted plaster was on the wall and the shower was very small and old. There was no bath as an alternative to the cramped shower. However, the beds were very comfy and changed with spotless sheets everyday. The towles were changed everyday but were very thin. In brief the room was clean and comfortable but let down cosmetically. The breakfast was nothing special but gave a reasonable choice of fresh pastries and fresh fruit, hams and cheeses. The cereal was not good. The staff were very helpful and friendly, and when we asked for a room change they did offer one, but it would of had to of happened at around 11 am. Not wanting to miss seeing the sights etc we decided to stick with the room. Afterall we were only there 3 nights. In the hotel's favor i have to say that our travelling companions had a much fresher, tidier room, number 307. It did not have a street view like ours, but had a huge bathroom with a shower and a bath and all fixtures were immaculate. In all I enjoyed the stay, the missus a little less, but considering we were out most of the day it was a reasonable cheap weekend away in the San Remo Hotel. The sights are second to none. Try and go to the Vatican on a Wednesday morning. Get there early to beat the crowds as the Pope holds a public blessing. Buy ticket for Colleseum at the Paletino to beat the queues. It is no more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: LettyDevon
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 day stay just to see the sites so The San Remo was ideal, walking distance to most. The hotel was fine no luxuries but clean, tidy and the beds were comfy. The hairdryer worked surprisingly well. I kept reading about the towels but they were great, dried really well and changed every day. The bathroom was good, best toilets I used the whole time I was in Rome. The shower was a bit small and leaked but not a problem. There was a fridge with a mini bar but I wish I taken a kettle as there was nothing to make a hot drink with. Breakfast was ok continental style (would of loved bacon & eggs one day) two many carbs. Didn't use the bar but beware it shuts at 10. The lift was fine broke once when too many people used it at once but was fixed straight away. Had a very good stay just a shame Rome wasn't so clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “sober”
Reviews.Author: Gerpaul
Reviews.Content: It is a sober hotel. We had the disabled room?, which is room nr. 110. When one has had a shower the whole bathroomfloor is flooded, as the drain is at the dooropening and there is only a curtain. The next person who wants to take a shower of go to the toilet, or brush his teeth has to waer boots. For braekfast coffee came from a machine ant tasted terrible. Beds were good. We only came there for sleeping, shower and braekfast, but when 2 out of three is a pain it doesn't give you a good feeling.

Reviews.Title: “good location...bad bites”
Reviews.Author: nat1401
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location, just beside the train station. Quite surprised it has 3 stars. There was no shower attachment on the wall so had to hook shower head over the bath taps. Stayed there for 3 nights and woke up with bites every morning, think were fleas in the bed spread. No one asked how our stay was so couldn't show them our lovely itchy bites!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tidange
Reviews.Content: The San Remo was a great hotel, offering everything you could need. The room was lovely, we only booked a double but were given a large triple. The continental breakfast buffet was great with lots to choose from. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location was ideal for us with a 13 month old baby it was only a minute's walk from the metro exit at Termini, via Cavour. A few tips for Rome! Don't use the Terravision bus from the airport. it did not arrive to take us back to Ciampino and we had to pay again to use the bus shuttle (another company) which was cheaper 6 euros and much more efficient! If visiting st Peters, go early it opens at 7am, it's great, hardly anyone is there and you get the best views from the top of the dome. If visiting the Colloseum pay the little bit extra 10 euros, to get a guide, you skip the big queue and get some great info.

Reviews.Title: “La dolce vita at the 'San Remo'”
Reviews.Author: peppermintT
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews of the 'San Remo' and its surrounding area before our holiday we were, at the very least, slightly concerned. Well, what can we say? It was a superb holiday and the 'San Remo' definately enhanced our experience of 'Bella Roma'! Even though we arrived an hour early for check in (1 pm) we were able to sort out a safety deposit box and could leave our cases in a secure room so we could start enjoying Rome that little bit quicker! As we're sure you know from previous reviews, the hotel is in an excellent location ( 5 mins from Termini station, 15 mins from Colosseum). Yes, the hotel isn't in the 'nicest' area of Rome but as long as you have an ounce of common sense you'll be fine! Back to the hotel - On the ground floor is a plush reception area, bar, and breakfast room. The safety deposit boxes are also located on this floor. If you're anything like us you might find it a wee bit strange that it's not in your room. Don't worry, the room is opposite the reception desk and there is always a receptionist on. Contrary to some comments the lift was fine, it wasn't hanging on by a thread of cable or anything like that. And we were very glad of it as we were staying on the 3rd floor ( just think of the poor souls on the 6th!) Our room was warm, spacious and clean, what else do you want from a bedroom? The beds might be a little on the hard side but after a full day of sight seeing who cares? The fridge was a mini blessing and well stocked with drinks, though we bought our own from a gorgeus little shop 2 doors away from the hotel. There is a T.V. in the room but I don't think we even had time to switch it on once! The bathroom was another thing we were really not looking forward to, but it was lovely. The shower was hot and quite powerful, the hair dryer was adequate and the towels (we had to mention the towels) resembled cotton sheets but were surprisingly absorbant. This was an excellent holiday and we just want to say a huge, contented 'THANK YOU!' to the wonderful San Remo staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed for the price”
Reviews.Author: jaguar0k
Reviews.Content: GREAT location. Great staff, blocks to dozens of cafes, other hotels, shopping and bus terminal. Loved the free breakfast. Bathroom was nice (hairy dryer) but no tub (ohhh the aching feet) very clean - room was larger and nicer than the one in paris for same price. Would stay there again. Room had refrig, but cheap, small TV. If you can figure out the bus system, it's only 1.50 - little confusing, hard to read bus maps.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, well-located, excellent value with deal I had”
Reviews.Author: ploughman8
Reviews.Content: Booked a single room (for 1 person) at the San Remo through Orbitz when they had their $200-off-for-5-days deal. The normal room rate through Orbitz for mid-January (Jan. 8-13) for that room was $70.87. With the Orbitz deal, though, I got the 5 nights for a total out-of-pocket of $203.57, or just under $41 a night. It proved to be an EXCELLENT deal. The room was smallish and fit an odd corner space, with an anteroom (more like a hall) having the closet and desk and the private bathroom in a similar odd space. As had been reported, the shower stalls were quite small (maybe only a square yard), probably due to retrofitting. Even though it was my first trip to Italy, I've stayed in plenty of under-$50 budget places in the Benelux countries and as far afield as Hong Kong, and from that perspective this place was very clean, well kept up and relatively spacious. The view from my window wasn't much, but I think it's still quieter and better to face the back rather than the street. TV was small, but they did have the Italian broadcast channels, CNN International and a few satellite channels. Location was excellent, about 3 blocks from Termini station. It's easy to walk over to catch buses, the Metro or intercity trains. The 40 Express or 64 buses were readily available to get to the Vatican or many places intown, the 175 to the Trevi Fountain, or the Metro to Colosseo station for the Coliseum/Palatine Hill. Desk staff was very helpful. The breakfast room was big enough to not overflow to the TV lounge, but space may be a problem if the hotel is totally full and everyone wants to eat at once, rather than spread out across the 7-10 a.m. breakfast hours. The included buffet breakfast was pretty good, neither frugal nor extravagant. Croissants with ham, cheese and salami and washed down with yogurt and tea helped start the day right. I had read the reviews before going and must say I'd have to see the glass as more than half full. Would even recommend at the $70 rate without the (long expired) Orbitz special deal. Of course, it was low season, so if you go in summer I'm sure the rates all around will be quite a bit more, and I think that had to be a major factor in some of the bad reviews. I was also very pleased with Rome in January. It wasn't that cold and the main weather problem was rain about half the time. But the big crowds causing long waits that the guidebooks had warned about were pleasantly absent, which made going to the Coliseum, Sistine Chapel and any of the museums much more enjoyable. Better to do that kind of thing in winter and hit the countryside and less-visited spots in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: potter1234
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice enough but they let someone in our room whilst we were out to dinner as "A light had to be fixed". We never mentioned anything about a light nor was there any problems with one. The guy went through a bag we had left unlocked (silly us) and stole some jewellery. When we asked about it at reception they told us straight out that they had let someone into the room, but weren't willing to do much about it. It was our word against their's so we just had to wear the loss Not to be trusted

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: MCSII_Trav-e-ler
Reviews.Content: spent the last weekend in rome in hotel san remo. good room (single room). water heat was fine. room was cleaned daily. got a safe near the lobby with no extra charge. breakfest was fair. the staff was nice and tried to help in any issue. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “dodgy area”
Reviews.Author: honeynutloop
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in a very nice area. I would not recommend it for girls travelling either alone or in a group. I booked it for its location and good value. It is indeed within walking distance to some of Rome's attractions and very close to the Station Termini, but I dreaded the walk home, felt unsafe and my boyfriend carried my handbag. We had to literally step over drunks and homeless people to get to our hotel. The room itself was always cold, no matter what way the staff fiddled with the ancient heating device, they gave us more blankets in the end. I regret not having asked to be moved. Breakfast is mediocre. I would suggest that someone booking a trip to Rome would look for a hotel around the Spainish steps (heard great reviews about the 'Hotel Forte') That area is gorgeous and looks safe. Highly recommend a trip to st. peters basillica on a Sunday. The pope speaks from his window, amazing experience. Enjoy Rome

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel that doesn't try to excel in any area.”
Reviews.Author: Mazdaman42
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a very nice 3 night break in Rome. If I could sum up the San Remo Hotel in one word, it would be 'Good'. The Hotel catered for everything we needed in terms of location and comfort although it didn't really excel in any area. To be honest, it doesn't really try to and that was just fine with me. Located a few minutes walk from the Termini station, the Hotel is far enough away to offer a quiet nights sleep and the road felt nice and safe. The Termini area itself is not really the best example of Rome, and the bus station is a bit of a dump (broken ticket machines, tramps etc). It’s quite a walk to the main attractions of Rome but the buses are frequent and cheap although they get very crowded. There are some good restaurants around the hotel with much better prices than those near the main attractions. Our room was nice and clean and the bed was very comfy. We really only used it as a place to sleep so was not after any great luxury. There was a TV that had a Sky box so we could watch BBC World. Bathroom ok but a bit tatty but again I wasn't fussed. No fluffy towels etc and instead some weird thin things but they did the trick. The biggest problem with the Hotel is the lack of hot water. One morning nothing came out of the hot tap at all although I tried 1/2 hour later and it was fine. I'm not a person who gets annoyed by this sort of thing but if you are then be warned! Breakfast was ok but could have done without the many Germans reserving all the seats for their families that hadn't got out of their rooms yet. This is something you have to live with wherever you go! Hotel staff very nice (one guy hilarious!). The stairway etc could have done with a lick of paint but was still clean. Would I stay again? Probably, but only if I was after a basic room for the night. If I wanted to stay in a bit more then I would really look elsewhere. But when staying in Rome, why would you want to stay inside at all!?!

Reviews.Title: “thank you all the wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: gillatt
Reviews.Content: I would just like to thank all the staff for a wonderful stay. I was there with my friend in September and the staff could not be more friendly and helpful. The room was not fance but it was adequate. Who needs a fancy room when one is only in it to sleep??? Clean white sheets, clean white towels, comfortable beds. the room could have done with a lick of paint but hey, after a days sightseeing who sees the walls!!! Bathroom clean. Breakfast good. Altogether a good family hotel. Thank you Stella Kerr SA

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel EXCELLENT location !!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Madally
Reviews.Content: After lots of internet searches and customer reviews myself and 2 friends decided to stay at the San Remo hotel in Rome. The staff were very helpful and friendly, the location was fantastic 2 mins walk from the Termini station (Rome's main station). In fact everywhere apart from the Vatican was within walking distance. The room was extremely spacious and clean. The only problem we did have was because we were on the 6th floor the first day we had no hot water however after speaking with the hotel reception it was immediately sorted out. All in all the hotel ticked most of the boxes and i would definately stay here again. Booked through hotelsclick.com the cheapest at the time of booking. The Metro was only 1 euro for a single journey to the vatican - 2 stops away. Word of advise - book online for vatican to avoid massive ques !!!!! best decision we made !!!

Reviews.Title: “Our saviour”
Reviews.Author: chocolate_hoops
Reviews.Content: After being turfed out from our other hotel (the ugly attitude of the Mecenate Palace Hotel), we found this hotel and they were our saviours. We walked straight in and asked if they had any rooms. The desk man was very helpful and we got 3 nights for a triple room for 450 euros. Not too bad I say. We were really happy to get a room. We were in Room 210. After having a little trouble trying to open the door (you need to pull the door and turn the key anticlockwise.) we got in and the room was big. It had its own little room. So our friend slept in the mini room, and me and my other friend slept in the bigger bit. Had a tv, and a spacious fridge (minibar) which is useful for those of you who want water. There is also a small convenience shop on the corner where this hotel is that sell bottles of water and various other drinks and MASSIVE sandwiches and rolls. Anyway the bathroom was big, but the door was broken which wasn't really a probably because it closed it just didnt click closed. The bath had some chips out of it which i would assume is where people keep dropping the shower head on it. But again, that kind of stuff doesnt bother us. The beds were a little bit rigid but you honestly do not want really squidgy beds in such heat. The cleaners were amazing! Everything was fresh and clean the next day after we went out, and if you leave anything on the floor they'll pick it up and put it on a chair or a bed. It was a tiny bit noisy at night which scared my friend a bit. They dont have air conditioning but we opened the window and even in the really hot weather that was enough. Its very close to the station and to any tour bus stops you might want to go to. Again the Staff were very helpful. So I recommend this hotel, I honestly don't think you'll get much better if you have a budget of under 180 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: natgoduk
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in room 307. I booked this hotel through Citalia and got 3nights for £90, and that was for two people. The San Remo has a welcoming reception area, with friendly staff who are very attentive. The hotel is very easy to find from the Roma Termini train station, we found it without even looking at the map. We were given a lovely spacious room, which was perfect for two people. The bathroom is a very good size aswell. The only complaint I had about the bathroom was the bath which looked like it had seen better days. The room was kept very clean by the maids, who always seemed very chearful every time we saw them. I would definatley recommend this hotel to friends and family and would love to stay at the San Remo when I next return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do it!!”
Reviews.Author: GeoffreyMarlow
Reviews.Content: The biggest problem with this hotel is that they cannot provide hot water when needed! On our first morning in room 606 there was no hot water, and I do not mean that it ran cold, there was no water, only from the cold tap. On taking this matter up with the desk I was told that this was quite normal when the hotel was full! It was suggested that if I waited it would eventually come back. We were eventually moved to another room but this made no difference. Breakfast is just passable as long as your jaw is in good working order to handle the rolls. The coffee was strong enough to wake the dead. The 'bar' was open as long as the odd job man, who doubled up as the barman, was available. Overall this is a poor 3* hotel. It is however very clean, so if you are prepared to put up with rest - enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: sicily_2007
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel to stay in during our fist trip to Rome. Its only 30 mins from airport and its easily accessible from termini. The high points are the location, you can walk to most major sights from the hotel in approx 30 -40 minutes and the hotel its self is very clean and quiet. The breakfast is ok with a range of continental options like cereals, rolls and sweet pastries. The major downside was the beds, they were uncomfortable to say the least, hard as rock and with a pillow to match, bathrooms had seen better days but were spotless clean. We stayed in mid April and the room at night was boiling, we had air conditioning but it didn't seem to do much good keeping us cool. All in all its clean and in a great location. Enjoy your stay !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Swainburn
Reviews.Content: Quiet, clean, good breakfast, excellent location: few minutes walking to Termini Station and metro. No traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “All Roads lead to Rome...”
Reviews.Author: PortsmouthTravelbug
Reviews.Content: After a 30 minute train ride on the Leonardo Express, (11 euros each,) clearly signposted and departing from the airport, we found the San Remo hotel very easily. It was only 5-10 minutes walk from the bustling Termini Station and check in was efficient by the friendly Reception staff. I would recommend that you collect a safety deposit key at this point...the safes are in the luggage room not in the bedrooms. We locked all our passports etc away, thank goodness, because later during our stay I had my purse taken in St. Peter's Basillica, of all places!!! Still, it didn't spoil our stay. Our room,on the top floor, was a large one with a double bed and a little side room with a single bed and a wardrobe. I had to ask the staff for extra hangers as there were only 4 in there originally and the extras arrived swiftly. The spotlessly clean bathroom was up a couple of steps so take care if you have to visit it in the middle of the night!! The towels were thin linen and I found they dried me perfectly, better than some fluffy towels. Our room faced out on to the back of the building, so there was no view, but we weren't in Rome to gaze out of the window. The mini bar was useful but we didn't buy anything from it, just used it to cool our own drinks. We didn't have any problems at all with the lift. Breakfasts in the hotel were a little basic but adequate. The dining room was fairly small but we always managed to find a table. Best part of the breakfast was the pot of fresfly brewed coffee, brought to you by the 2 waiters, if you could catch their eyes! Location of the hotel was excellent...not only close to the Termini station but also to the rather limited but cheap Metro system. To be honest, if you are fairly hale and hearty and don't mind walking, Rome is best seen on foot. You can take frequent stops to enjoy a cup of coffee, an ice cream or whatever takes your fancy. Just make sure you have a comfy pair of shoes...the pavements etc are very uneven. Some surfaces, of course, were from ancient times! Some other tips for Rome...? Patience is required. Long queues at the Vatican Museum and the Colosseum but worth the wait. Avoid the 'organised groups'...buy a good guide book. You need to like your fellow man! All major sights thronging with people..even in February. Friendly waiters in several restaurants close to the hotel...practise your Italian on them! Keep vigilant..there are pickpockets everywhere. Buy a good map...signposts are a rarity. Eat a delicious Tartufo ice cream in the Tre Scalini in the Piazza Novona. A pizza at lunchtime in any restaurant will set you up for the rest of the day. Use the loos when you stop at a bar or cafe...you won't find them anywhere else. Soak up the history of Ancient Rome in the Forum, Colosseum and the Pantheon. Truly spectacular monuments. Be amazed at the Sistine Chapel ceiling and be stunned into silence by the 'shhhshing' guards. Check in your guide book and try to visit some of the lesser known areas. We really enjoyed our visit, despite my loss, and would use the San Remo again as a base.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Fantastic!!!!! Dawn & Liam (37) (40) West Mids”
Reviews.Author: doodar
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night break staying at the hotel San Remo, we did't want to come home and could quite easily have done a runner on the day of departure !!!! After reading so many reviews on this hotel i thought we should let you know a little more! We found San Remo on a great little site called Citalia-recommended by a friend - right from the start they were proffessional and helpful, very reasonably priced too! Our trip included transfers wich i would recommend as when we arrived at the Airport the disorderly lines to catch coaches/buses into the city was scarey , we were met by a very handsome devil who escorted us to our Mercedes - very stylish we felt like royalty. We later found out that Mercedes are widely used in Rome as Taxis anyway , but what a nice touch! We arrived a little early for check in and we did have to wait 1 hour before going to our room, this gave us a chance to go and explore a little and have a beer. One thing we did find over the 4 days stayed is that if you like a beer its very expensive, we paid 28 euros in one place for 4 beers! and thats their measure not ours- we found a very good Irish Bar that was fun as the Rugby was on and it was St Patrics day, so was full of friendly fans, you can find this if you turn left out of hotel - left again then right . San Remo is just around the corner from the Terminal wich is a little seedy and their are lots of umbarella sellers -great if its raining we did buy one at 5Euros and it broke the next day- ha ha - also many rough sleepers in this area. Ok -we thought after reading so many reviews that all the major sites would be miles away so before we left we had already decided to catch one of the many Tour Buses - DONT - everything was easier to get to than we first thought - Collesium im not joking we stumbled upon whilst looking for somewhere to eat, 15 mins walk away from hotel and breath taking!!! Trevi Fountain-Spanish Steps my favourite a little further away about 30 mins - but the walks around the city are just breath taking so dont miss anything by taking trains/subways - except for the Vatican, we took the number 64 bus wich cost 4 euros each it took about 25 mins and was worth it as if walking we would never have found it , you have to put your ticket into a very aggressive machine once on the bus - so watch your fingers, the Vatican was very striking i had to tell my other half to shut his gaping mouth several times but it is a remarkable place to see and it will take around 4-5 hours just to see some not all - to do this you would need a few days,its huge!- if you go by bus you will need to buy your tickets from the Terminal Stands - If your into visiting the Hard Rock Cafe - go for it - its in the Quirinalle District on the way to Trevi - what a cool place - there are also many plazzas and squares on the way to everywhere where you can take a break and sit on one of the many water fountains chill out out or eat in the many many resturants - we did not have one bad meal whilst in Rome- so as you can see we had a great time -saw everything very easily and want to go back already , i would reccomend San Remo Hotel to anyone who wants to be in a central location - we stayed on the 5th floor room 509, the room was basic with new laminate flooring and they were cleaned daily, our room was at the back with no view but hey - it was quite after great days out, staff are friendly, nothing wrong with the Lifts ! yeah the Towels are thin but when in Rome and all that !!!!for a 3* hotel in a great location GO GO GO !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Soulee
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old son and I (single mom) stayed at the San Remo Hotel from August 12 to 16, 2006 in a nice double-room with a balcony overlooking the street. It was a clean, airy spacious room, with large bathroom; everything was cleaned during the day and fresh towels every day. I loved the towels which I think were real linen! We walked to the hotel from the Leonardo Da Vinci train platform at Termini, pulling our luggage, and had no trouble finding the hotel. Just exit Termini from the main front entrance, cross the road, turn right and walk down the first street you come to. We arrived early, but the receptionist was very accommodating and we were in our room in 20 minutes. The day we left, we were able to leave our luggage in their luggage room, take a tour of the Vatican Museums, Sistine Chapel and St. Peter's, pickup our luggage, walk to Termini and get to the airport in plenty of time to catch our flight to Athens. The only thing we didn't like was that breakfast wasn't available until 7 a.m. and several of our tours left at 6:45 a.m. They will pack you a bagged breakfast (not very appetizing) if you ask the night before. Also the night receptionist (approx. midnight to 7 a.m.) was a grumpy old man, not very pleasant when you are looking for breakfast at 6:30 and didn't know to ask for a boxed lunch the night before. Other than that, the San Remo is a very pleasant, convenient place to stay because it is close to Termini, the subway, bus station (outside Termini), several restaurants, the Museo Nazionale di Roma, several churches, the Baths of Diocletian, etc. It is about a 30 min. walk to the Colosseo. We loved Rome and enjoyed our stay at the San Remo and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: swatts1
Reviews.Content: 7 people recently traveled in Italy. We stayed in 3 rooms: 2 doubles and 1 triple. We arrived in Rome at the Termini Rail Station and the hotel was a short walk and very easy to find. The area immediately around the station was a bit seedy, but the nearer we got to the hotel, the better the surroundings looked. The lobby was fairly old fashioned but was clean. We arrived several hours ahead of check in. The man at the desk was accommodating and we were in our rooms in about 20 minutes. There is a small, slow lift, but we were very happy to have it available to us. The rooms all had new laminate flooring. The double rooms had very dated furniture and the mirrors on the armoires were cracked. Drawer pulls were missing but the rooms were clean. There was a faint cigarette smell in one room, but an open window took care of that quickly. The baths were also clean, but the tubs were not in great shape and the bathrooms could use an update. The hairdryers needed replacing. The triple room was nicer than the doubles. It contained a small room with a twin bed, a larger room with two twins and a much larger bath than the double rooms contained. Hotel staff was pleasant, though English seemed to be somewhat of a problem. The breakfast service was adequate and the waiters were very nice. A variety of pastries, cereals, juices and yogurt were served. The desk person helped us arrange for a large van/cab to get us to Leonardo Da Vinci airport for an early morning flight. We would probably prefer another location in Rome next time. For a budget accommodation this hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “++ Pleasant Hotel ++”
Reviews.Author: SanRemoSurvivor
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the San Remo on the 23rd Oct 2006 and stayed 2 nights leaving early on the 25th. We found that the hotel was a pleasant and friendly hotel in a quiet area (compared to the rest of Rome) with some good restaurants near by. It was somewhere which made a good base to come back to to rest our tired feet after a long day of walking and touring the many fabulous sites of Rome. All of the hotel staff spoke reasonable English and had no problems in understanding what we were saying to them. We got a nice double bed room on the 4th floor (room 401) which from a small balcony overlooked the front street. The room was basic but had everything you would want and was clean and in a good condition. (cleaned every morning by cleaners who always gave a cheery hello). Another benefit was that the room was air conditioned which made a nice change to the hot weather outside. The only downside was that the shower had very little power and was more of a dribble than a spray, but it got you cleaned. Oh and if you like to dry your hair with a hairdryer I would recommend you bring your own... However apart from this the room was totally adequate and we were very happy with it. (don't worry about the dreaded towels you may have been reading about, they were fine). Finally breakfast, very continental will sum it up well. The grub included pastries, cakes, bread, jam, chocolate spread, yogurt, fruit salad, cheese, ham, fruit juices, tea and coffee and one tub of cornflakes. (how do you like that for specific)? There are a few bad reviews for the San Remo on this site but have no fear, they were either written along time ago or they were looking for bad things to say (in my opinion). Yeah, the lift was a bit slow and shuddery and you feared for your life everytime you went in it, but it got you there and I'm still alive and yes the towels were slightly thin, but they dried you perfectly. Everyone has their own opinions I suppose. I personally enjoyed my trip to Rome very much and the hotel was not a worry at all, I would certainly recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a nicely priced, adequate 3 star hotel. Hope you enjoy your holiday to Rome and that this review has been of some use and reassurance to you. Alex Treliving (San Remo Survivor) Oct 29th 06

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel San Remo
HotelInfo.Address: Via D'Azeglio Massimo 36, 00128 Rome, Italy
